title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of White Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in bottle of wine white (750 ml standard), including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdown for dry varieties.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of White Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle; dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc or Chardonnay) with ~12% ABV; no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, brand, ABV, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry white wine contains about 615 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of white wine?
faqs.a: About 615 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry white wine.
Yes, around 19.5 g total carbs per bottle, mainly from residual sugars and alcohol fermentation.

faqs.q: How does sweetness affect calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Sweeter varieties add 100–200 kcal per bottle due to higher sugars.

faqs.q: What's the alcohol content impact on calories?
faqs.a: Higher ABV increases calories; 12% ABV is standard for ~82 kcal per 100 ml.

faqs.q: Are there fats or proteins in white wine?
faqs.a: Negligible—0 g fat and ~0.8 g protein per bottle.
